Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (6 ll.) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Acknowledgement of receipt of dowry(?) by Pekusis son of Pibes from [his wife cf. 10593] Tetimuthes daughter of Petetumis. Date year 9 Payni 17 of Ptolemy Philometor = BC 172 July 19". Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (diagr. C, no.10)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2742) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2742)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, dirty, delaminating Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (warped) Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
